      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(BufferOutput buffer,
                        Serializer serializer)
        Description copied from interface: CopycatSerializable
        Writes the object to the given buffer.

        Implementations of this method should write object attributes to the given buffer. Note that assumptions cannot be safely made about the given buffer's Buffer.position(), Buffer.limit(), or any other navigational attributes of the provided Buffer. To navigate the buffer, set the buffer's Buffer.mark() and Buffer.reset().

        When writing dynamically sized attributes such as strings and collections, users should always write the attribute's size to the given buffer. Copycat makes no guarantee that the buffer provided to CopycatSerializable.readObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferInput, Serializer) will reflect the number of bytes written to the buffer during serialization.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to which to write the object.
        serializer - The serializer with which the object is being serialized.
        See Also:
        CopycatSerializable.readObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferInput, Serializer)

      • readObject

        public void readObject(BufferInput buffer,
                       Serializer serializer)
        Description copied from interface: CopycatSerializable
        Reads the object from the given buffer.

        Implementations of this method should read object attributes from the given buffer in the same order with which they were written to the buffer in CopycatSerializable.writeObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferOutput, Serializer). Copycat guarantees only that the current Buffer.position() will reflect the start of the bytes written by CopycatSerializable.writeObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferOutput, Serializer), but not that the Buffer.remaining() bytes reflect the number of bytes written by CopycatSerializable.writeObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferOutput, Serializer).

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer from which to read the object.
        serializer - The serializer with which the object is being serialized.
        See Also:
        CopycatSerializable.writeObject(net.kuujo.copycat.io.BufferOutput, Serializer)
